meanings.definition: The quality or state of being substantial.
meanings.sent1: Her essay lacked substantiveness, as it was filled with fluff and lacked depth.
meanings.sent2: The substantiveness of the building's foundation ensured its stability during the earthquake.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the substantiveness of the hidden compartment to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent4: The substantiveness of her arguments made them impossible to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The substantiveness of the evidence presented in court convinced the jury of his innocence.

meanings.definition: The ability to provide substance or support.
meanings.sent1: The substantiveness of the scholarship program helped many students pursue higher education.
meanings.sent2: In times of crisis, the community values the substantiveness of mutual support.
meanings.sent3: The cake's substantiveness surprised everyone, as it looked light but was actually quite dense.
meanings.sent4: His friendship provided a substantiveness to her life that she had been missing.
meanings.sent5: The substantiveness of her advice gave him the confidence to make the right decision.
